question: In in vivo murine xenograft models of human glioma, does siRNA-mediated knockdown of A20 slow tumor growth and improve mouse survival? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: The tumorigenic potential of GSCs was decreased with A20 targeting, resulting in increased survival of mice bearing human glioma xenografts.
content.source_2: While siRNA-mediated A20 knockdown curtailed glioma cell proliferation in vitro, orthotopic murine xenografts showed no delay in tumor progression and survival was unaffected.
content.source_3: In a murine xenograft model, local delivery of A20-targeting siRNA produced a significant suppression of solid tumor growth in vivo.
content.source_4: Although A20 is overexpressed in glioma tissues and cell lines, inhibiting A20 expression failed to slow tumor growth in mice, with xenografts progressing at rates comparable to controls.
